title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live on Wednesday 12 July 2017 - BBC News
summary: fundraising page set up for river death boy .
murder probe over woman 's a38 death .
underpass wall turned into legal graffiti spot .
england v new zealand at derbyshire 's county ground .

documents.title: test match 'to bring in £ 10m '
text: the test match at trent bridge could see nottinghamshire 's economy benefit by an estimated £ 10m .
thousands of cricket fans are in town to see england take on south africa .
some 60,000 tickets have been sold for the first four days and nearly every one of nottingham 's 4,371 hotel rooms is full .
it all adds up to a big boost for the ground and dozens of local businesses .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: student killer had breached bail 24 times
text: bail breaches by a man from derby who killed a student in leeds six years ago were handled in a `` fundamentally flawed '' manner , an ipcc report has found .
jagdip randhawa , 19 , ( from hounslow , hit his head on a pavement after he was punched by boxer clifton ty mitchell in leeds in 2011 .
he died in hospital five days later .
mitchell , now 26 , from derby , was convicted of manslaughter and jailed for seven years in 2012 .
he 'd breached bail conditions for a previous violent offence 24 times in the preceding five months but no action was taken .
the procedure in place at the time of the incident was fundamentally flawed and was not fit for the control of persons deemed by the court system to require active monitoring .
this process was in my opinion so flawed that none of the staff operating under it appeared to recognise the ongoing issues with this one individual and see the obvious opportunities missed . ''
derbyshire police has said procedures have since been reviewed and were now more robust .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: transport projects need hs2 money now , says dennis skinner
text: there should be a `` reassessment '' of the `` pie in the sky '' plans for the hs2 high-speed rail link , according to bolsover mp dennis skinner .

mr skinner said : `` why does n't the secretary of state for transport tell his friends that some of these so-called projects are pie in the sky from the government that 's already committed to spending more than £ 80bn on the hs2 .

`` why does n't he get real and understand there should be a reassessment of hs2 believe me there are a lot of people on both sides of this house are fed up of the idea of spending money in the far distant future for hs2 when there 's all these projects on the order paper today where they want action ? ''
transport secretary chris grayling said he `` very surprised '' that mr skinner was opposed to a scheme that would improve rail capacity in the north of england .
the birmingham to leeds leg of hs2 is expected to pass through towns including long eaton and sandiacre .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : latest from east midlands ' roads
text: market street in ashby de la zouche is closed and you 're being advised to avoid the area
can i ask why ?
my sister is on the way to work in ashby - thanks
closed by police james
brilliant thank you
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: student death punch man 's bail 'flawed '
text: student death punch man 's bail 'flawed '

documents.title: school staff sentenced over near drowning
text: school staff sentenced over near drowning

documents.title: man denies murdering 16-year-old
text: man denies murdering 16-year-old

documents.title: our live coverage has ended
text: regular live coverage on this page has ended for the day , but breaking news , sport and travel updates will continue to appear through the night .
east midlands live returns from 08:00 on friday .

documents.title: thank you tea for community police officers
text: two community police officers were invited to afternoon tea by the sheriff of nottingham , councillor glyn jenkins to thank them for their service .
cpo flora has been with the hyson green beat team since 2008 but is leaving to take up a new job with derby city council .
flowers and a card , signed by local residents were also handed to cpo flora , who is leaving the hyson green policing team after nine years .
3/3 we would like to wish sukhi all the best & say a massive thank you for everything you have odone & we will miss your cheeky laugh
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : dry and bright evening ahead
text: it will be a bright evening ahead with some showers but it will generally feel mild with temperatures reaching 14c ( 57f ) .
there will be some clouds which will thicken during the night but it should remain largely dry .
tomorrow will see some light drizzle in the morning but with sunny spells later in the day .
temperatures will reach highs of 19c ( 66f ) .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: airport sees a hike in passengers
text: this summer is set to be the busiest on record at east midlands airport .
in the last 12 months , 4.7 million people used it and numbers will continue to rise , according to their website .
during may alone there was a 4 % rise in passengers compared to the previous year .

jack kelly , from the airport said : `` if you look at how people are going to get to the airport , as we plan to double our passengers over the next 10 to 15 years , we are going to have to get people here by some other way than road .

`` we are desperate for the government to make big improvements to east midlands parkway with that we will put our money where our mouth is and put £ 2.5m into improving connections to the airport from that facility . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: wisdom : everyone knows i love derby
text: wisdom : everyone knows i love derby

documents.title: ice cream for train visitors
text: it may not have been a ty summer 's day but ice cream was handed out to guests at the official opening of ilkeston railway station today .
the sun held out just long enough for ice cream at the official opening of # ilkeston station .
# emttreats
we stopped off to have a look yesterday , station looks great but the road overbridge could do with a little tlc we thought .
thanks for the feedback kieron .
we take all our customers comments on board and will pass the remarks on to the area > >
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man used false name to store illegal cigarettes
text: a man , who used a false name to store and sell thousands of pounds worth of illegal cigarettes , has been been sentenced .

philip tatham , 53 , of alfreton road , in sutton-in-ashfield , used another name to rent a storage unit to hold 198,000 illegal cigarettes and 125kgs of hand rolling tobacco , worth £ 74,989.16 in unpaid duty .
he was sentenced to 18 months suspended for two years at nottingham crown court yesterday .
following an investigation , a stanley knife with tatham 's dna on it was found , at the storage unit in kirkby-in-ashfield .
he admitted renting the unit but claimed he sub-let it to a third party who must have owned the cigarettes .
tatham was charged with storing cigarettes and keeping rolling tobacco with intent to defraud .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: murder accused claims teen girl 's strangle death was accident
text: a man accused of murdering a 16-year-old girl by strangling her in his bedroom has told a court he did not intend to kill her .
james morton , 24 , denies murdering hannah pearson after taking her back to his home in newark .
mr morton told the court miss pearson 's death was an accident caused by him strangling her as they began to get intimate , having seen it in a film a few weeks earlier and being curious to try it .
asked by his defence counsel whether he intended to harm miss pearson , he replied `` not at all '' .
he gave the same response when asked whether it was his intention to kill her and he said there was no reason he would have wanted her dead .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: stop-smoking project facing the axe
text: a scheme which gave new derbyshire mums £ 750 if they stopped smoking looks set to be scrapped .
derbyshire county council will make a decision next week .
author: Chris Doidge
BBC Radio Derby, political reporter

documents.title: doorman shooter jailed for 20 years
text: doorman shooter jailed for 20 years

documents.title: man jailed for shooting bouncer
text: a man who deliberately shot a doorman in the leg after he was kicked out of a nightclub has been jailed for 20 years .
theodore antonio paget , 29 , was told to leave sub8ten , in leicester , but returned soon after on 8 may 2016 .
leicester crown court heard he pulled a gun on one doorman , then shot and injured another who intervened .
paget , of no fixed address , was found guilty by a jury of wounding with intent after admitting unlawfully wounding .
author: Samantha Fisher
BBC News Online

documents.title: man critically ill after alvaston assault
text: a man is in a critical condition following an alleged assault in alvaston .
police said the 34-year-old was reportedly attacked in cropton close on friday afternoon .
an 18-year-old man has been charged with assault occasioning grievous bodily harm and remanded in custody .
two other men , aged 18 and 20 , were questioned about the incident but have been released while investigations continue .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: loughborough university rapist has sentence increased
text: a rapist who targeted students at loughborough university has had his prison sentence increased .
on three separate occasions during a six-week period in 2010 , ibrahim elamin lay in wait and attacked male students as they walked home from nights out .
the 35-year-old was jailed for seven years and eight months at leicester crown court in may .

however , elamin 's sentence has been increased to 11 years and three months after the court of appeal agreed with the solicitor general robert buckland that the original sentence was unduly lenient .
speaking after the hearing , mr buckland said : `` these were premeditated attacks , preying on young men on their way home .
young people should be able to enjoy a night out and walk home without fear .
`` i felt the original sentence did not accurately reflect the seriousness of this offending and i am pleased that the court of appeal agreed with me . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: have you seen missing macey ?
text: macey bondswell , 14 , was reported missing from southwell at 11:00 this morning .
nottinghamshire police believe she has links to hyson green , st ann 's and carlton .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: derby north mp williamson wants to halt library shake-up
text: labour 's derby north mp chris williamson has called on derby city council to look at alternatives to its community-run libraries plan .
the labour authority 's cabinet last night approved plans to hand 10 of the city 's 15 libraries to volunteers as part of a shake-up of the service aimed at saving £ 700,000 a year .
mr williamson said he wanted to help the council find `` alternative solutions that do n't require librarians to be made redundant '' .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: summer sunsets in rothley and breedon
text: leicestershire was treated to some stunning sunsets last night - these two ( use the right arrow to flick to the second one ) were taken in rothley and breedon on the hill .
author: Instagram

documents.title: 'knife arrests ' at derby school
text: pupils at da vinci academy in derby witnessed fellow students being arrested for trying to carry in weapons this morning .

however , the arrests were not actually real - they were part of an elaborate scenario dreamt up by students - and supported by the emergency services - to drive home a hard-hitting message on the dangers of carrying knives .
watch my report
author: James Roberson
Reporter, East Midlands Today

documents.title: 'increase in hate crime reports '
text: reports of hate crime in nottingham have increased by 47 % since the brexit vote and the recent terror attacks , say police .
nottinghamshire police said 1,418 hate crimes were reported between june 2016 and may 2017 , but it put the increase down to people being more confident about coming forward .
victims of hate crime held a meeting at the karimia centre in nottingham to speak about their experiences .
tyrone nash , who has asperger 's syndrome , described some of the terms people have used again him .
he said : `` i have had people calling me a freak , spaz , mong .
i have had it on buses , i have had it in town , but now i 'm older , i just think the people who call me those sort of names need to grow up . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: teenage cyclist 'serious but stable ' after little eaton crash
text: a 13-year-old boy is in hospital in a serious but stable condition '' after he was hit by a car while on his bike .
paramedics , an air ambulance and police officers were all called to alfreton road in little eaton at about 18:00 yesterday and the teenager was taken to the queen 's medical centre , in nottingham .
the road was closed following the crash and re-opened at about 21:45 .
author: Samantha Fisher
BBC News Online

documents.title: ilkeston railway station officially opened
text: ilkeston railway station was officially opened today .
trains began running again in april - for the first time in 50 years - but a special event was organised by east midlands trains this afternoon .
school children have been invited to design new railway safety posters to mark the opening of the station .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: coalville regeneration allocated £ 777,000
text: three significant projects in coalville will benefit from £ 777,000 , as part of the regeneration of the town .
north west leicestershire district council said this means they have invested a total of £ 3m in the town 's regeneration between 2015 and 2019 .
the first project will see £ 577,000 used to redesign marlborough square to make it easier for pedestrians to use and reduce the number of vehicles , including buses and taxis .
a total of £ 25,000 will be used to improve the memorial square by creating a space for people-held events or the display of commemorative artwork .
out of the total budget , £ 175,000 will be used on improving traffic on ashby road and investing in snibston country park .
work includes straightening the carriageway and planting trees to create an attractive route into the town centre .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: derbyshire brass band perform at coldplay show
text: a brass band from derbyshire welcomed fans to coldplay 's show in cardiff yesterday .
cressbrook band performed the hit speed of sound .

documents.title: vandal charged after targeting police car
text: police tend to take a dim view of this sort of thing
damage caused to police vehicle outside # bakewell police station .
offender identified , arrested and charged to court
did n't think you had any trouble up in bakewell with it being a posh place to live so i 've been told
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: have you seen this man missing in leeds ?
text: a man from nottingham has gone missing in leeds after a night out with a friend .
jeremy lancaster , 24 from sherwood , had gone to a gig in the city but has n't been seen since late last night .
he was last seen wearing a grey t-shirt with `` abandoned ship '' written on it .
officers say they are growing increasingly concerned for his welfare and if anyone knows where he might be to get in touch urgently .

documents.title: sports direct buys quarter stake in game
text: mike ashley 's sports direct has bought a quarter stake in struggling computer games retailer game digital .
game said shirebrook-based sports direct had bought 44 million shares , a 25.75 % stake , and said it looked forward to `` working collaboratively '' with the company .
mr ashley , currently involved in a court dispute with an investment banker , already has stakes in debenhams , french connection and findel .
his investment in game comes a month after the company issued a profit warning , blaming poor supplies of the nintendo switch console .
author: BBC Business News

documents.title: owen jenkins : bikers to wear purple
text: bikers taking part in a tribute ride for a 12-year-old who drowned on monday have been told to wear purple .
the ride 's organisers , nottz bikerz , said the colour was owen jenkins ' favourite .
the ride will start at the beekeeper pub in beeston on 23 july and finish at beeston weir , close to where owen went into the water .
it is thought he was helping a friend who had fallen into the weir .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : forklift rips cctv from building society wall
text: remarkable video footage has been released showing a telehandler being used to rip a cash machine from the front of a building society in ashby .
the brazen smash-and-grab happened in market street at about 03:00 on monday and police believe an audi and a truck were also involved .
leicestershire police said : the bobcat was used to ram the front of the building in order for the suspects to remove the cash machine which caused a significant amount of disruption .
we have released the cctv footage which clearly shows three vehicles in the area and the incident itself taking place . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : raiders rip out cash machine
text: watch : raiders rip out cash machine

documents.title: hot weather has caused early rape seed harvest
text: while many of us enjoy the hot weather , it has affected the harvesting of barley across the east midlands .
farmers have said the dry winter and recent heat has led to an early rape seed harvest .
the unpredictability of our seasons makes it difficult for growers to plan ahead , so the university of nottingham is looking at how to make crops more climate resistant .
joe stanley , who runs a farm near coalville , said : `` it is becoming increasingly unpredictable .
this year 's harvest was at least a fortnight early due to the weather we had in june '' .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: government defends record on minority ethnic teachers in leicester
text: this table highlights the large discrepancy between the proportion of black and minority ethnic ( bme ) pupils ( the red line ) and teachers ( the orange line ) in leicester .
the figures , obtained by the bbc , show 70 % of pupils in the city 's schools are bme , but the figure is less than 30 % for teachers .
the department for education has defended its record on bme recruitment .
a spokesman said : `` there has been a steady increase in the proportion of minority ethnic groups starting teacher training and in the teaching profession in recent years .
`` we also provide a range of support to teachers from black and ethnic minority backgrounds such as the leadership , equality and diversity fund .
`` this fund supports schools to increase the representation of bme teachers in senior leadership roles as well as providing coaching and mentoring for bme teachers . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: collapsed sewer shuts spondon road for ten days
text: a road in derby will be closed for more than a week after a sewer collapsed .
severn trent said it would be a `` big difficult job '' to repair the `` very deep '' sewer beneath sancroft road in spondon and it was expected to take about 10 days .
the firm has put a diversion in place but said residents would still be able to access their properties .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: schoolgirl 'threatened by limping stranger '
text: a 12-year-old girl from derbyshire has told police she was approached yesterday by a limping white-haired man who asked her to go with him and then threatened her .
she said she encountered the man , who was in his 50s or 60s and had a large belly , while walking along dronfield road in eckington at about 09:10 .
the girl ran away and now police are trying to trace the man .
call 101 if you can help .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'well done dexter '
text: diane evans got in touch via facebook after reading about the east midlands ' fire investigation dog passing his annual licensing tests .
she said : `` had the pleasure of meeting dexter and his handler when they visited smalley school .
nice one dexter .
keep up the good work . ''
i 'm sure you 'd enjoy dexter 's twitter account too , diane .
author: Facebook

documents.title: ecb head protection research 'welcomed '
text: ecb head protection research 'welcomed '
author: Andrew Aloia
BBC Sport

documents.title: fletcher open to head protection ideas
text: fletcher open to head protection ideas

documents.title: your photos : summer in derbyshire
text: now that 's what you call a great sunset shot .
it was taken in wingerworth by janice 's patch .
author: Instagram

documents.title: foxes target sigurdsson to miss pre-season tour
text: gylfi sigurdsson will not travel to the united states for swansea city 's pre-season tour , heightening speculation that he is to leave .
swansea have rejected a £ 40m bid from leicester city for the player , but manager paul clement said the `` business side to football '' meant the club might have to sell him .
everton have also been linked with the former tottenham hotspur player .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: fletcher open to head protection ideas
text: fletcher open to head protection ideas

documents.title: rowett says trimming squad will take time
text: gary rowett says reducing the size of his derby county squad will be no quick fix .
will hughes ( tom ince , abdoul camara and cyrus christie have already left this summer and rowett says he expects it may take more than one transfer window to move some players on .
the rams travel to moss rose on saturday for a pre-season friendly against macclesfield town .
author: Ed Dawes
BBC Radio Derby Sport

documents.title: nottingham mp greenwood will chair transport select committee
text: nottingham south mp lilian greenwood has been chosen as the new chairwoman of the transport select committee .
the cross-party group scrutinises government policy and the performance of transport operators .
the labour mp was elected to the role last night .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: nottingham 's beach is back
text: we might not have had much sunny weather over the last few days but this will get you into the summer spirit .
nottingham beach is back and this year there will be a caribbean themed bar as well as a tv screen showing events like the wimbledon final and the trent bridge test .
take a look at our video on instagram for a glimpse of what 's in store .
author: Instagram

documents.title: watch : fire dog passes his exams
text: massive congratulations to dexter , the east midlands fire investigation dog , and his handler dave coss .
the smart canine has passed his annual licensing tests with flying colours and is free to continue assisting at fire scenes across the region .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ofsted concerned about educational standards in derby
text: school inspectors have raised serious concerns about educational standards in derby .
ofsted says schools are not progressing in the city because there are too few academy trusts in the area with experience in improving struggling schools .
it says the regional schools commissioners , who oversee standards in academies , are too slow to take action .
the government said it had made progress but the pace of improvement in some areas was not good enough .
author: Gillian Hargreaves
Education correspondent, BBC News

documents.title: foxes 'to offload six recent signings '
text: leicester city get a couple of mentions in today 's bbc sport football gossip column .
it includes speculation in the daily telegraph that a number of recent signings - including islam slimani - could be heading for the exit ( lexit ?
fexit ? )
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: trent bridge gets barriers after terror attacks
text: security barriers have been put up on trent bridge and surrounding roads to protect thousands of cricket fans attending this weekend 's test match .
the county council says it has taken the measure with the city council on the advice of central government in the wake of recent terror attacks - but stresses there 's no specific threat .
radcliffe road and bridgford road also have barriers .
author: Kevin Stanley
Reporter, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: nicky morgan to lead treasury committee
text: loughborough mp nicky morgan has been elected as chairwoman of the treasury select committee .
the former education secretary saw off five other tory mps to land the coveted role scrutinising the government 's finances .
it means morgan , who was pro-remain in the eu referendum , will have a major role in monitoring the terms of brexit over the coming months .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : nottingham beach opens
text: time to dig out your bucket and spade - nottingham beach is back in the market square .
the popular attraction opens today and will be in place until 3 september .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: traffic and travel : m1 latest
text: some mixed news for you if you 're usingr the m1 this morning .
firstly , northbound between j30 ( worksop ) and j31 ( sheffield south ) just the one lane now remains closed following an accident and traffic remains slow on that carriageway as a result .
better news further north on the m1 as two earlier problems on on the at j33 ( rotherham ) and another at j42 ( m62 interchage ) have both returned to normal .
author: Adam Pinder-Smith
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: ten derby libraries to be handed to volunteer groups
text: final approval has been given to hand ten of derby 's 15 libraries over to volunteers .
the shake-up - aimed at saving the city council £ 700,000 a year - will also see derby 's central library relocated from its current wardwick base to the council house on corporation street .
it will mean the loss of 46 jobs - 39 library staff and seven cleaners .
the 10 libraries set to be managed by volunteers are chellaston , sinfin , chaddesden , blagreaves , allestree , allenton , mackworth , spondon , springwood and derwent .
the council will run central library ( to be renamed riverside library after its move ) , local studies library , alvaston , pear tree and mickleover .
the building currently housing derby 's central library will be handed to derby museums trust and may be used as a space for events .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'serious concerns ' about derby schools
text: 'serious concerns ' about derby schools
author: Gillian Hargreaves
Education Correspondent, BBC News

documents.title: listen : woman abuses 999 staff
text: in case you missed it yesterday , this remarkable phone call is well worth a listen .
it features the voice of stacey white , a nottingham woman who 's made hundreds of abusive 999 calls over the past six years .
east midlands ambulance service said her actions had cost the nhs £ 31,000 in the past year alone .
she 's now been jailed for the offence .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: water problems in sutton-in-ashfield
text: if you live in sutton-in-ashfield you may have woken to find you have no water or low pressure this morning .
severn trent says the problem has been caused by a burst water pipe at the junction of kirkby road and spring road and its engineers are at the scene .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: teenage cyclist seriously injured in little eaton crash
text: a 13-year-old cyclist was seriously injured in a crash in derby last night .
the boy was taken to the queen 's medical centre in nottingham after colliding with a volkswagen polo on alfreton road in little eaton at about 18:00 .
the crash led to a section of the road being closed for about four hours .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: traffic and travel : m1 delays across yorkshire
text: seperate incidents on both the north and soutbound of the m1 are causing disruption across yorkshire this morning .
firstly northbound , two lanes are closed between j30 ( worksop ) and j31 ( sheffield south ) due to an accident and as you can see from the camera delays are continuing to build :
once through that , the nortbound side is also suffering at j33 ( rotherham ) as a broken down vehicle on the exit slip road means traffic is finding it difficult to leave the carriageway .

meanwile , in west yorkshire a lane is closed southbound between j42 ( m62 interchange ) and j41 ( carrgate ) after reports of a pedestrian on the road but traffic through that stretch seems to be coping well , looking at speed sensors and cameras .
author: Adam Pinder-Smith
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: call for more ethnic minority teachers in leicester
text: a union says it would like to see more ethnic minority teachers in leicester .
research by the bbc found 70 % of children in the city 's schools came from minority backgrounds but the figure for teachers was below 30 % - one of the largest imbalances in england .
patrick roach , deputy secretary of the nasuwt , said : `` we need to have schools that are reflective of the communities they serve .
`` we should also have schools which draw in the best possible talent from young graduates and the population at large who can deliver the best education for children and young people . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: thomas burns killing : man charged with manslaughter
text: a man has been charged with the manslaughter of thomas burns , who died after being assaulted in hyson green on sunday morning .
mark purdy , 39 , of coxmoor court in bestwood , has also been charged with affray and is due to appear before magistrates this morning .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: paralysed woman fears cuts may force move
text: paralysed woman fears cuts may force move

text: regular live coverage on this page has ended for the day , but breaking news , sport and travel updates will continue to appear through the night .
east midlands live returns from 08:00 tomorrow morning .

text: clear spells overnight and light winds will allow a few mist patches to form , mainly in rural areas .
minimum temperature : 12c ( 54f )
there will be early mist patches soon clearing leaving a bright sunny morning tomorrow .
cloud will build by early afternoon with the odd shower developing .
maximum temperature : 21c ( 70f )

BBC Weather

documents.title: foxes learn efl trophy opponents
text: leicester city 's u23 squad will face carlisle united , fleetwood town and morecambe in the group stage of this season 's efl trophy .
the young foxes , managed by steve beaglehole , reached the first knockout round last season before losing to cheltenham town .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man charged after stabbings in hucknall
text: a man has been charged with a range of offences in connection with a number of public order incidents in hucknall town centre .
it was reported that a group of men were being abusive and threatening outside the plough and harrow pub , on high street , just before 20.30 on 4 june .
two men were later stabbed in high street and suffered minor injuries .
a 20-year-old man from hucknall has been charged with attempted robbery , three offences of aggravated possession of a bladed article , assault occasioning actual bodily harm and theft of petrol
he is also charged assault relating to an incident in bristol in may .
nottinghamshire police said the man appeared before nottingham magistrates yesterday and was remanded into custody to appear at crown court next month .
author: Ben Truslove
BBC News Online

documents.title: owen jenkins : bike ride to be held
text: bikers will take to the streets to pay tribute to owen jenkins , who died after falling into the river trent .
the nottz bikerz group has organised the event , which will take place on 23 july starting at the beekeeper pub , in beeston .
they will ride over to beeston weir where a two minute silence will be held in memory of the 12-year-old .
there will also be a collection for owen 's family , who have lived in beeston rylands for many years .
it is thought owen was trying to save a friend when he fell into the weir on monday .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cricket : england beat kiwis in derby to reach world cup semi-finals
text: it 's all over at the county ground - england have beaten new zealand to book their place in the semi-finals of the women 's world cup .
natalie sciver 's brilliant century helped england post a total of 284 before they bowled out the kiwis for 209 .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: abusive caller jailed for ringing 999 almost 2,000 times
text: an abusive caller who rang the emergency 999 line 1,868 times and cost the nhs £ 30,000 has been jailed for six months .
stacey white of burnthouse road , heanor , regularly called east midlands ambulance service and was often abusive .
here she is shouting at a call handler about her wrist , which the service said was n't injured
she made the 1,868 calls since 2011 , of which 498 calls were made since march last year .

white appeared at derbyshire magistrates ' court last month , charged with persistently making use of a public communications network to cause annoyance , inconvenience and anxiety for the recent offences .
she was sentenced to 26 weeks in prison .
in 2014 she was prosecuted for misusing the number and physically assaulting a paramedic and was handed a 20-week suspended prison sentence at the time , the service said .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rowett keen to reduce rams squad
text: rowett keen to reduce rams squad

documents.title: matlock water problem fixed
text: severn trent says water supplies in matlock should be back to normal now .
they were disrupted earlier this afternoon after a power failure stopped a vital piece of equipment working .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: bus crashes into busy nottingham roundabout
text: a bus has crashed into traffic lights on maid marian way roundabout in nottingham .
the bus driver was taken ill at the wheel , nottinghamshire police said .
traffic remains backed up along maid marian way and derby road , however the bus is currently being recovered and the road will reopen shortly .
the driver has been taken to queens ' medical central .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: passenger numbers up at east midlands airport
text: east midlands airport says passenger numbers were up 4 % in may compared to the same month in 2016 .
more than 4.7m people have travelled to and from the airport over the past 12 months , with 502,000 passing through in may .
managing director andy cliffe said an extra 100 members of staff had been recruited as the airport prepares for its busiest summer on record .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: in young snow leopard at twycross
text: one of twycross zoo 's new arrivals is the chosen photo on bbc leicester 's instagram account today .
so beautiful !
author: Instagram

documents.title: water supply problems in matlock
text: water supplies in the matlock area have been disrupted after a power failure affected a piece of equpiment , severn trent has said .
the firm assured customers its engineers were working hard to fix the problem .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : masked man targets carlton store
text: video footage has been released showing a masked raider attempting to rob a shop in carlton .
police said the man , who was carrying a bag with a metal object inside , ran away when the shopkeeper produced a baseball bat .
anyone with information on the attempted robbery , which happened in foxhill road on 26 june , is asked to call 101 .
warning : third party content may contain adverts .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: badminton league could return - kellogg
text: badminton league could return - kellogg

documents.title: man convicted of shooting doorman
text: man convicted of shooting doorman

documents.title: women 's world cup : new zealand chasing 285 for victory
text: an exciting run chase in prospect at the county ground .
england have set new zealand a target of 285 to win .
author: Ed Dawes
BBC Radio Derby Sport

documents.title: your photos : summer in notts
text: there 's a real buzz around nottingham at the moment thanks to paul farmer for the
author: Instagram

documents.title: official opening for dale centre
text: the new £ 1m dale centre in sneinton has been officially opened .
the joint service centre has a new library replacing the old bakersfield and sneinton libraries and is home to the neighbourhood police team .
it is based in the former police station site in sneinton dale .
the centre opened in may but an official ceremony took place today where the sheriff of nottingham , councillor glyn jenkins opened it .

documents.title: i felt no pain from ball hit - fletcher
text: i felt no pain from ball hit - fletcher

documents.title: endangered snow leopards born at twycross zoo
text: look at these cute snow leopards
the two female cubs are the latest additions at twycross zoo , the third pair for mum irma and dad suou .
they were born in april but spent time with their mother for a few months in a den to allow them to settle , but they are now venturing around .
they have older siblings , a boy and a girl born in 2011 and two boys born in 2013 .
snow leopards are classified as endangered and are native to the mountains in central and south asia , the zoo said .
the two girls are growing at an incredible rate and their mother irma is doing a fantastic job looking after them .

she has been amazing since day one and i am sure these little girls will grow into strong and healthy females that will help our efforts in maintaining a sustainable population of snow leopards in zoos around the world . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: peak district brass band to perform at coldplay concert
text: a brass band from derbyshire is preparing to play for 60,000 coldplay fans in cardiff this evening .
cressbrook band were invited to perform as the audience arrives at the band 's gig at the principality stadium after chris martin saw a video of them playing viva la vida at a recent gala .
the brass band said they were `` pinching ourselves '' to be invited and were looking forward to introducing their sound to a new audience .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: victims of fatal m1 crash in leicestershire named
text: two men who died in a crash on the m1 in leicestershire last week have been named by police .

antony richard west , 53 , from buckingham , and andrew william chevis , from banbury , were killed when their fiat 500 was involved in a collision with a lorry and a vauxhall corsa near j20 on 4 july .
the corsa driver suffered minor injuries but the lorry driver was unharmed .
police have appealed for witnesses .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: county ins & outs 2017
text: county ins & outs 2017

documents.title: traffic lights removed from busy nottingham road
text: if you are driving along canal street in nottingham you may be aware of changes to the traffic restrictions .
traffic lights have been removed at the junction with middle hill and a give-way system has been introduced .
the pedestrian island is now bigger but there are now only two westbound lanes instead of three which is in line with the rest of canal street from the roundabout .
it is part of improvements to the roads in the city centre ahead of the broadmarsh carpark and bus station demolition .
ramps have been introduced in both directions on canal street to slow traffic .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cricket fans enjoy england v new zealand at county ground
text: decent turn-out at the county ground for england v new zealand in the women 's world cup .
england are currently 91-3 after 21 overs .
author: Ed Dawes
BBC Radio Derby Sport

documents.title: your photos : summer in derbyshire
text: good to see blue skies again after yesterday 's wash-out .
this pic was taken in draycott by mark 's landscape .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: murder probe after woman dies on a38
text: a man has been arrested on sus of murder after a woman died when she was hit by a vehicle on the a38 near burton .
the woman had been travelling in a van with a man , 39 , on thursday evening but died after being struck by another vehicle .
staffordshire police said the man , from hull , had been remanded in custody after being charged with breaching a restraining order .
he has been released in relation to the murder charge while police inquiries continue .
police said they were working with authorities in lithuania to confirm the woman 's identity .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'contaminated blood killed my father '
text: a campaigner from derby has welcomed the government 's decision to order a public inquiry into the scandal over contaminated blood , which cost the life of her father and affected thousands of others .
katie walford , from darley abbey , was ten when her father david , a haemophiliac , died after being infected with hiv and hepatitis c from contaminated blood the nhs had purchased from abroad .
her family has been calling for an inquiry for more than 20 years into whether the nhs knew more about the problem than was revealed to the public .
speaking about the moment she heard there was to be a public inquiry , she said : `` i had my best friend and my husband with me .
there were hugs and the tears was rolling , i was grinning from ear-to-ear . ''
`` but then you wipe the tears away .
it 's now go time - the fight is nowhere near over . ''
author: Wesley Mallin
Reporter, BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: homes left without power
text: there has been a power cut in parts of leicestershire and nottinghamshire .
properties in hoton and costock are affected but power should be restored by 13:00 .
we are aware of a # powercut in the # hoton # costock # le12 and surrounding area .
we aim to restore all supplies by 13:00 .
andi .
it would be really helpful if you could include a reason and a better time estimate rather than a 'default ' .
power is now restored in hoton
hi stuart , if you 'd like to dm me your full address i can look into this for you please .
dm also has more characters to explain .
ellie
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cricket : england looking to book semi-final spot
text: this was the scene at the county ground a short while ago as national anthems were played ahead of england 's match against new zealand in the women 's world cup .
england won the toss and elected to bat - a win will see them secure a place in the semi-finals .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: queues in coleorton following accident
text: it may be best to avoid the a512 at coleorton , in leicestershire for now .
# leicestershire queues on the a512 at colerton accident between the rempstone rd turn and the a42 avoid for now
thanks .
will avoid : )
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: school starts epic game of boules for charity
text: staff at a school in derbyshire are attempting to set a new world record for the longest ever game of boules .
the french sport was selected by teachers and pupils at woodville school in swadlincote after they looked at endurance records they could take on .
the 53-hour marathon - which began this morning and will conclude on friday - has been organised to raise funds to help build a new school in nepal .
the school said its £ 15,000 fundraising target had already been reached .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: owen jenkins : thousands raised for 'loving family '
text: a fundraising page has been set up in memory of owen jenkins who died after falling into the beeston weir .
so far £ 7,633 has already been raised for owen 's family , who have lived in beeston rylands for many years .
tributes are still pouring in for the 12-year-old who drowned in the river trent .
one woman , who knows the family well , said : `` i used to work with the mum and they are a fantastic , loving and caring family .
`` it has just touched so many people , they are so well liked in the community , you know , everybody knows them .
`` you ca n't put into words how the family are feeling . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: work continues on pedestrian crossings today
text: you might have noticed things have calmed down roadworks-wise in nottingham city centre over the past few days , but they 're back from today .
finishing touches to a new pedestrian crossing around canal street will begin today in preparation for the demolition of the broadmarsh car park .
the work will be done off peak .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: notts bowler fletcher out for season
text: notts bowler fletcher out for season

documents.title: owen jenkins : community comes together to pay their respects
text: friends and team mates of owen jenkins paid their respects yesterday evening .
owen , 12 , died after falling into the river trent at beeston weir on monday .
it 's thought he might have been trying to help a friend .
nottingham casual rfc and rylands methodist church opened their doors for the community where a vigil was held and candles were lit .
cheryl smith , from rylands methodist church , in beeston , said there was an `` outpouring of grief in the community '' since the tragic accident .
flowers have been laid near the weir and a book of condolences has been placed at the canalside heritage centre , in beeston .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rams kick off pre-season campaign with big win
text: derby county got their pre-season campaign off to a successful start with a comfortable 4-0 win over kidderminster harriers .
david nugent , craig bryson and chris martin scored in the first 45 minutes , before darren bent ( added to the scoreline in the second half at aggborough stadium .
afterwards , manager gary rowett said : `` i am happy with the fitness of the players , their sharpness and some elements .
`` we limited kidderminster to very few chances and the concentration levels were good .
i thought some of the performances of the younger players were really encouraging too . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: power back on in castle donington
text: castle donington has electricity once again
all supplies in the # castle-donington # de74 and surrounding area have now been restored .
apologies to all customers affected .
ellie
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: london bound train delays cleared
text: earlier , we brought you news of delays for train services heading from sheffield to stations towards london this morning .

a broken down train at around 07:30 this morning , just south of sheffield station , was causing significant delays but live departure boards are no longer showing any additional journey time for passengers bound for the capital .
there are still some minor delays on northern rail services between barnsley and sheffield due to vandalism in the meadowhall area .
meanwhile trains moving from derbyshire into south yorkshire have also now returned to normal .
author: Adam Pinder-Smith
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: properties could be without hot water and heating for 24 hours
text: hundreds of properties across nottingham , particularity in st ann 's , may be without hot water or heating this morning .
enviroenergy , which runs the district heating system , has started essential annual maintenance .
this will mean some houses may not have hot water or heating for the next 24 hours .
city councillor alan clark said : `` the hot water will gradually reduce , because you have to take all the pressure out of the system .
`` water will reduce in temperature from early in the morning and yes they will have to boil kettle to do the essentials . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: derbyshire teenager missing for four days
text: police are looking for a 14-year-old girl who has been missing for four days .
lois elliott left her home in dove holes on saturday evening and has not been seen since .
it 's thought she could be in the merseyside area .
police have asked anyone with information to call 101 .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: leicestershire underpass becomes 'legal street art wall '
text: street artists have been invited to express themselves without fear of prosecution after a leicestershire underpass was officially designated a legal street art wall .
the tunnel , which connects whetstone and blaby beneath the a426 , has been the target of unsightly grafitti for many years .
the district council hopes making it legal will raise the standard .
the pilot scheme saw an event held last month in which artists were invited along to transform the wall .
the council now hopes the wall will be self-managed by the artists involved .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: water problems in clay cross
text: some homes in clay cross are without water or have low pressure due to a burst water pipe , severn trent has said .
the firm said its engineers were working on the problem and aimed to get supplies back to normal as quickly as possible .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: foxes say goodbye to german goalie
text: in case you missed it , ron-robert zieler is no longer a leicester city player .
the 28-year-old german goalkeeper has been sold to stuttgart for an undisclosed fee after a year with the foxes .
despite being a member of the world cup-winning german squad in 2014 , zieler only managed 13 appearances for leicester last season .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: libraries shake-up to be discussed by council cabinet
text: derby city council 's cabinet will discuss handing most of the city 's libraries over to volunteer groups tonight .
part of the idea would be to close the central library on wardwick and move it to the council house on corporation street .
the plan would save over half a million pounds but cost around 46 jobs .
author: Wesley Mallin
Reporter, BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: power cut in castle donington
text: if your electricity 's gone off , you 're not alone
we are aware of a # powercut in the # castle-donington # de74 and surrounding area .
we aim to restore all supplies by 09:30 .
ellie
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police name man who died after assault
text: the man who died after suffering a serious head injury during an assault has been named as thomas burns .
the 40-year-old died in hospital on monday following an assualt in hyson green at about 06:00 on sunday , nottinghamshire police said .
officers have arrested a 39-year-old man and a 24-year-old man in connection with his death .
the 39-year-old remains in police custody and the 24-year-old has been released pending further investigation .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: photo appeal after markeaton park rope course vandalised
text: police have released photos of a person they want to speak to after the high ropes course at derby 's markeaton park was vandalised .
the attraction had to be closed after the ropes were damaged on 26 june - the latest of several attacks on the course .
police said the boy in the photo was riding a hoverboard and was probably aged between 14 and 17 .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: leicester 's indian community 'misled ' about brexit benefits , says cable
text: liberal democrat leadership candidate , sir vince cable , has suggested that large parts of the british indian community in leicester , were sold lies about the benefits of voting for brexit .

he said : `` i spent quite a lot of time in leicester , where quite a lot of the british indian community voted brexit because they had been led to believe that if we left , the british government would open up visas to people from india .
`` i do n't see any sign of it happening . ''
about 60 % of all work visas issued by the uk go to indian nationals , according to the british government .
it added that the uk is open to the `` brightest and best '' from india .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : updates from across the region
text: travel : updates from across the region
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

text: here 's how it 's looking

BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: join us for today 's live coverage
text: good morning nottinghamshire , derbyshire and leicestershire .
gavin bevis and i will be writing the updates on today 's live page with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel .
if you 'd like to get in touch with us , you can send an email , or use facebook or twitter .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live
